title: US technology giant Nvidia has surpassed Alphabet and Apple in market value
text:
The Santa Clara, California-based company's market capitalization reached $1.830 trillion on Wednesday, surpassing Alphabet's (Google) $1.820 trillion. © Agenzia Nova - Reproduction reserved The US technology giant Nvidia, leader in the production of microchips and motherboards, continues its ride supported by its position of near monopoly in the rapidly growing sector of computation for artificial intelligence (AI). The Santa Clara, California-based company's market capitalization reached $1.830 trillion on Wednesday, surpassing Alphabet's $1.820 trillion. (Google). Nvidia had also overtaken Amazon earlier in the week, closing Tuesday with a market value higher than that of the e-commerce and cloud computing giant for the first time since 2002.   In May 2023 Nvidia was the first semiconductor company to reach a market value of $2024 trillion. Since then, the US company's shares have continued to rise thanks to Wall Street's enthusiasm for the AI ​​sector. Since the beginning of 49, the value of Nvidia shares has grown by 239 percent, after a jump of 2023 percent in XNUMX. To date, few other companies boast a market value of over one trillion dollars: these include Apple, Alphabet, Amazon and Microsoft.
